text: <@UF6M5BW4C> strangely for me the styles and script files are not being replaced by the local versions, HubSpot seems to replace the my main.js file with main.min.js is there a fix for this ?
<@UF6M5BW4C> Glad someone else is giving this repo some love.  I
I've built a workflow around this, and it's sped up my builds significantly

I started yesterday with HubSpot and I got a webpage in a .pdf file and I need to create it in HubSpot CMS... how would you, or how should I approach this problem?
Should I first create a : Drag&Drop | HTML and HUBL | Module
I am insecure, all is new for me...I don't know how to start rolling with this

<@UFQR010N8> I would start with evaluating the PDF layout they sent, if it looks straightforward and grid like, you should be able to use the drag and drop for it. Then you would just need to hook up the proper CSS files and style correctly. If it request customization or complex items, you can look at using the drag and drop for the page shell and then creating custom modules for the more complex pieces.

using the coded files (html + hubl) is based on personal preference honestly.  Some people use it some don't.
I'd also begin by reviewing HubSpots Docs on HubL and Custom Modules
<@UEC65BQV8> how are you uploading your files? with FTP? also, would you be able to reference the CDN links from your templates in the local hubl server? or do you need to reference them locally?

<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/intro-to-hubl>
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/getting-started>
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/boilerplate-css>
check out that repo.  It
It's got a good readme in it.  Files are uploaded via the API through a gulp task
also check out the discovery kit for new devs on the HS Platfrom <https://designers.HubSpot.com/discoverykit>
<@UFH0F0BD3> could you give a snippet of your HubL that isn't properly using your local .js files?
Essentially, it eliminates the need for the local server altogether.  You just edit a copy of a live page that gets spun up on a local server.
OK <@U2H3TT8F2> as I understand you it is possible to make a page simply by creating first the Drag&Drop file
I have a feeling there is a lot of reading coming at me
this is totally new.... i mean HubSpot needs to be learned to be able to work with it
Correct, you can create a drag and drop template, then under your *Marketing > Website > ....* you can choose to create a page/landing page and then when creating that page assign a template to it

<@UFQR010N8> <https://app.HubSpot.com/portal-recommend/l?slug=learning-center/tracks/34>

If you go here there’s a video course that will give you the basics of working with HubSpot

Here are the articles on using templates:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/structure-and-customize-template-layouts>

and on creating pages:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-pages-editor/create-and-edit-pages-in-HubSpot>
<@U7SL518D6> that is exactly what I needed.... i am a very visual person, first i need to see it in action then I can understand much faster
thank you
Hang on to all of the links AJ gave you as well, those will all be very helpful
ok one more quick question
what is the difference between a landingpage and a webpage

That's a debatable topic honestly, early on Landing Pages offered things like A/B testing whereas Webpages didnt, but now that they do. So there really isnt too much of a difference. Usually (at least how we do it) is landing pages are the one off pages used for things like ebook offers, webinars, or other content offers.

Website pages are just any pages related to your site as a whole

<@UEKMY50SU> from my local dev I could always reference the files uploaded (via FTP at this point, haven't explored the api option yet, but that is ton of work as I am also a designer and creating a lot of assets on the fly as I build the site. When deving locally, its easy for me to whip new assets, export from illustrator/sketch/photoshop to an img asset folder and then just reference them locally. If I have to upload an update ref urls for every asset, that seems...cumbersome IMO

ah yeah, agreed. i thought they might have already existed in the file manager, but sounds like they don't. in that case, i don't think there is currently a way around using the `file_manager` prefix locally, and removing it after upload

LP - conversion-centric
Website - informative

At least how I understand it

A very notable and important difference related to what AJ said is Landing Pages are not automatically added to your sitemap (they can manually be added) - they are intended to be temporary campaigns in nature
so don't make pillar pages under Landing Pages if possible?
well depends is your pillar page connected to your main site or does it feel standaloneish
True, I was operating under a more SEO-mindset though in terms of bots crawling a sitemap. Not a massive deal but was wondering how big a difference that could make
also assuming you didn't manually add it to the sitemap

`<script src="{{ get_public_template_url('Website_-_Jan_2019/Javascript/main.js') }}"></script>` this is what I am using in design manager to load javascript, also I am using a similar link tag for main.css.

hmm <@UFH0F0BD3> that snippet loads a local .js file just fine for me. When you load that template, could you take a peek at the console logs for me? Do you see a line that looks something like `GET //127.0.0.1:8080/_hcms/raw-resource?path=Website_-_Jan_2019/Javascript/main.js`?
<@UEKMY50SU> nope this is what i get repeated a couple of times `Content Security Policy: Ignoring “https:” within script-src: “strict-dynamic” specified`
i got it somewhat working by setting `"overWriteLocal": false` in `config.json` but now it just loads my styles and scripts another time.
oh, you're using <https://github.com/Absanater/HubSpot-frontend-local/>? That tool isn't built by HubSpot, and I'm not familiar with how it works
sorry about that, i thought you were using the local hubl server
Yep <@UEKMY50SU> thanks anyway, I am planning to checkout local Hubl server once I complete this ongoing project and invest sometime into a better workflow.
okay, if any local hubl server questions arise feel free to post them in <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools>
Hi <@UCH1L597V> - yes it was a cache issue for me!
is there a way to easily check why HS is not minifying or combining CSS?
might have to wait a bit, i know i had that issue and it shouldnt take more than 15-20 mins for HS to cache your changes then start applying the combined/minified css/js
what if it's been days? :confused:
paging <@U6GNQ7JBU> or <@U6TBZ66FN> for that one
<@U26D0TF8E> does your css file have an @supports?
if it has an @supports they do not minify or combine. The minifier can’t handle it.
I don't believe so
just confirmed and there aren't any @supports
hmm,  very odd
and not to ask a stupid question but you don’t have the hsdebug param in the address do you?
nope I wish I had to use it jajaja
I've CSS linted the crap out of this stylesheet and nothing makes is min or combine

okay not certain on this but one more thing to check because it’s caused me problems in the past.

Do you have any media queries that have an `or` in them?
hmmm I haven't checked for that...hold on
it’s not likely you needed to use it, but I have seen the minifier choke on the space after the `or` causing it to be invalid and can theoretically make it fail to minify
none of those either
:shrug: fraid’ I got no idea then. Probably gonna have to wait till the HS Pros get in in the morning. <@U6TBZ66FN>’s pretty awesome when it comes to caching and minifying problems.
sounds like a great reason to call it for the day then! Thanks for the assist <@U2H3TT8F2> & <@U7SL518D6>!!

Will take a look tomorrow morning. For minify, we do not minify the file contains `0s` or `@support`, and some some other things I don'r recall. For combining: we will first try to verify the combined css does not bread the look of the page  -- so if it does, we will keep trying periodically util it does not break pages (hope there will be some changes to the page or css).
huh, interesting to know about the 0s
Thanks <@U6TBZ66FN>, however, not sure what you mean by 0s, can you clarify?
I think he means `0s` as in like css transitions
for 0 seconds
ah ok
Yes, 0 second.
